page.title: 07Health In South Kyme
page.content: South Kyme has no Doctor's surgery or Chemist. Patients travel to surround- ing villages. Doctors or a nurse may arrange a home visit. People requiring hospital treatment journey to Lincoln or Boston. A Voluntary Hospital Car Scheme was initiated locally, to take those with no transport. Dental care is emphasised, and dentists practice in local towns. During pregnancy, expectant mothers attend ante-natal clinics at the Doctors and hospital. Almost all babies are born in hospital. Midwives and later Health Visitors monitor the childs development. Twice monthly Child Welfare Clinics are held at Billinghay. An interest in Alternative Medicine is developing, and also keeping fit through a more healthy diet and exercise.
